intro: Hesperis patula, commonly known as the sweet rocket, is a biennial or short-lived perennial plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that range from white to pink and purple, resembling those of the snapdragon. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and slightly aromatic. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens. Hesperis patula is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
